org.opendaylight.controller.sal.connection

Interface IConnectionService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionService

    public interface IConnectionService
    Interface that defines the methods available to the functional modules that operate above SAL for disconnecting or connecting to a particular node.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node connect(java.lang.String connectionIdentifier, java.util.Map<ConnectionConstants,java.lang.String> params)
      Discover the node type and Connect to the first plugin that is able to connect with the specified parameters.

      Connect to a node with a specified node type.

      Disconnect a Node that is connected to this Controller.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        Node connect(java.lang.String type,
           java.lang.String connectionIdentifier,
           java.util.Map<ConnectionConstants,java.lang.String> params)
        Connect to a node with a specified node type.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the node representing NodeIDType.
        connectionIdentifier - Convenient identifier for the applications to make use of
        params - Connection Params in Map format. This is entirely handled by the south-bound plugins and is an opaque value for SAL. Typical values keyed inside this params are Management IP-Address, Username, Password, Security Keys, etc...
        Returns:
        Node Node

      • connect

        Node connect(java.lang.String connectionIdentifier,
           java.util.Map<ConnectionConstants,java.lang.String> params)
        Discover the node type and Connect to the first plugin that is able to connect with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the node representing NodeIDType.
        connectionIdentifier - Convenient identifier for the applications to make use of
        params - Connection Params in Map format. This is entirely handled by the south-bound plugins and is an opaque value for SAL. Typical values keyed inside this params are Management IP-Address, Username, Password, Security Keys, etc...
        Returns:
        Node Node

      • disconnect

        Status disconnect(Node node)
        Disconnect a Node that is connected to this Controller.
        Parameters:
        node - the node Node
        Returns:
        Status Status
